Interface BoardInterface

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable

    public interface BoardInterface
extends java.lang.Cloneable
    You should define a constructor with no parameters

      Find if all the ships on the board have been sunk

    • Method Detail

      • placeShip

        void placeShip(ShipInterface ship,
               Position position,
               boolean isVertical)
        throws InvalidPositionException,
               ShipOverlapException
        Add a ship to the board with the top/left position specified
        Parameters:
        ship - The ship to add to the board
        position - The top/left of the ship position
        isVertical - True if ship is to be placed vertically, otherwise the ship should be placed horizontally
        Throws:
        InvalidPositionException - if the not all of the ship squares fit onto the board
        ShipOverlapException - if the any of the squares of the ship to be added would overlap with an already placed ship

      • shoot

        void shoot(Position position)
    throws InvalidPositionException
        Update the board state by shooting at the given position
        Parameters:
        position - The position to shoot at
        Throws:
        InvalidPositionException - if the shot position is not on the board

      • getStatus

        ShipStatus getStatus(Position position)
              throws InvalidPositionException
        Find the status at the given position
        Parameters:
        position - the position to find out about
        Returns:
        The status at the given board position
        Throws:
        InvalidPositionException - if the position is not on the board

      • allSunk

        boolean allSunk()
        Find if all the ships on the board have been sunk
        Returns:
        True If and only if all the ships have been sunk

      • toString

        java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        A string representation of the board, suitable for printing to the screen

      • clone

        BoardInterface clone()
        Make a deep clone of the current object. Only clones of boards are to be passed to a player by a game, so that the player does not affect the game state if shots are tried out
        Returns:
        the cloned object
